courseDetail.name: Human Values in Governance and Public policy
courseDetail.institute: Sri Sathya Sai Centre for Human Values
courseDetail.summary: Scientific and economic progress continues to be the two main pillars of measuring development of a society. However, any development bereft of Human Values can be a double-edged sword. Do Human Values play a role in development of a society? If so, how and what role can they play in governance and therefore in public policy.

description.desc1: Scientific and economic progress continues to be the two main pillars of measuring development of a society. However, any development bereft of Human Values can be a double-edged sword. Do Human Values play a role in development of a society? If so, how and what role can they play in governance and therefore in public policy.
description.desc2: In this programme, organised exclusively for the serving AIS & other Central   Services officers, we intend to explore the above in HealthCare Education and Social Sectors.

list.listSubject: Proposed objectives of this program are:

listDescription.listdesc: The role Human Values play in personal and professional excellence
Examining a model

authorAndCurator.author: Prof A Sudhir Bhaskar
authorAndCurator.curator: Director, Sri Sathya Sai Centre for Human Values

topic.topicTitle: Human Values in Governance and Public policy in Health care Education and Social sector

topicDescription.desc1: Scientific and economic progress continues to be the two main pillars of measuring development of a society. However, any development bereft of Human Values can be a double-edged sword. Do Human Values play a role in development of a society? If so, how and what role can they play in governance and therefore in public policy.
topicDescription.desc2: In this programme, organised exclusively for the serving AIS & other Central Services officers, we intend to explore the above in HealthCare Education and Social Sectors.

list.listSubject: Proposed objectives of this program are:

listDescription.listdesc: The role Human Values play in personal and professional excellence
Examining a model developed and practiced by Sri Sathya Sai Central Trust through its service institutions.

topicDescription.desc3: The participants will be exposed to concepts and inputs through presentations and discussions with experts from our own institutions and invited      eminent guest speakers. Further to these interactive sessions, Experiential based field visits to School, University, Super and Mobile Hospitals (serving in a village) are organised for the participants to observe how the service delivery happens. During these visits, the participants would get an opportunity to interact with the service delivery personnel in their locations of work. Based on these inputs, the participants would gain insights into the practice of Human Values. In turn, the participants could introspect how the insight gained from the above would help them perform   their functions differently. www.ssschv.org

courseDetail.name: Fiscal Policy: Management and Emerging Issues
courseDetail.institute: National Institute of Public Finance and Policy (NIPFP)
courseDetail.summary: Fiscal policy in India , fiscal instruments, Project Management

description.desc1: The course would begin with an overview of fiscal policy in India and the linkages in inter-governmental finances. The refresher module would cover fiscal instruments, understanding of the budgetary process, instruments of debt and overlap of fiscal and monetary policy. The module on revenue and expenditure management would deal with medium term revenue and expenditure strategies and cover empirical work on off-budget borrowings both at the national and sub-national levels, tax reforms, subsidies, pension, debt sustainability, macro-economic monitoring tools. Project management module could cover project appraisal techniques, internal audit, public-private partnerships in infrastructure projects. Module on emerging and growing concerns on climate change redress may cover issues in taxation, debt, national accounting.

authorAndCurator.author: Mukesh Kumar Anand
authorAndCurator.curator: Course coordinator

topic.topicTitle: Human Values in Governance and Public policy in Health care Education and Social sector
Revenue and expenditure management
Project management

topicDescription.desc1: The course would begin with an overview of fiscal policy in India and the linkages in inter-governmental finances. The refresher module would cover fiscal instruments, understanding of the budgetary process, instruments of debt and overlap of fiscal and monetary policy. The module on revenue and expenditure management would deal with medium term revenue and expenditure strategies and cover empirical work on off-budget borrowings both at the national and sub-national levels, tax reforms, subsidies, pension, debt sustainability, macro-economic monitoring tools. Project management module could cover project appraisal techniques, internal audit, public-private partnerships in infrastructure projects. Module on emerging and growing concerns on climate change redress may cover issues in taxation, debt, national accounting.

courseDetail.name: Environment Impact Assessment: Development Projects
courseDetail.institute: Environment Protection Training and Research Institute (EPTRI), Hyderabad
courseDetail.summary: The course on Environmental Impact Assessment (Development Projects) will strengthen the individual officials’ capacities in integrating environmental concerns into all sectors of development.

description.desc1: The EIA training programme is designed to introduce the concept of EIA, its history, outlines and methodology adopted in India, placing it within the framework of sustainable development.
description.desc2: The course is different from those offered by other institutions as it places EIA within the framework of sustainable development and gives practical exposure to the participants on the ongoing EIA projects. It also gives examples and case studies illustrating key aspects of professional practice for environmental managers.

authorAndCurator.author: Dr. Rajeswar Jonnalagadda
authorAndCurator.curator: Course Coordinator

authorAndCurator.author: Mr. Raveendra
authorAndCurator.curator: Chief Environmental Scientist EPTRI

topic.topicTitle: EIA, its history, outlines and methodology adopted in India, placing it within the framework of sustainable development

list.listSubject: Specific skills proposed to be instilled in the participants with regard to governance and administrative/technical skills:

listDescription.listdesc: Understanding of Environmental Laws and their Implementation.
To help policy makers executing integrate environmental concerns into other sectors and address inter-sectoral issues.
To make environmental governance participatory and transparent.
Competency to latest end to end online EIA evaluation process.
To strengthen decision making through impact assessment perspective.

courseDetail.name: Kaushalam – Excellence in action ONLINE
courseDetail.summary: Highly interactive and practical sessions with a rich and diverse global faculty of accomplished suited for todays busy lifestyle

description.desc1: The current times call for a new collective leadership capacity to meet challenges in a more conscious, intentional, and strategic way.
description.desc2: Heartfulness invites the Officers to Kaushalam, a course that has been successfully running for past 6 years and allows one to access & operate from the innermost quality of our being, and through meditation, reach new realms of awareness and consciousness.
description.desc3: It will ensure officers manage their stress better and well nuanced in policy-making at all levels of nation building as it leverages on the officer’s inherent ideals and strengths, breaks silo-mindsets and delves deep into their core values as the beacon for decision making.
description.desc4: Highly interactive and practical sessions with a rich and diverse global faculty of accomplished suited for todays busy lifestyle.
description.desc5: It’s a set of Daily self practice tools and its significant positive impact on daily work and personal life.
description.desc6: This will allow optimal decisions, poise and peace of mind, joyful living making its positive impact on work, family, social and personal life.

It will ensure officers manage their stress better and well nuanced in policy-making at all levels of nation building as it leverages on the officer’s inherent ideals and strengths, breaks silo-mindsets and delves deep into their core values as the beacon for decision making.

courseDetail.name: Building Competencies for Personal Excellence
courseDetail.summary: Building Competencies for Personal Excellence is a unique offering of The Art of Living for senior Group A - IAS, IPS, IFoS officers etc.

description.desc1: This program has been tailor-made to build and upgrade certain competencies identified under NTP-2012 which are mostly personal or intrinsic in nature (as opposed to professional competencies), which are central to good governance.
description.desc2: These competencies are clubbed together under the umbrella of 'Personal Excellence'.
description.desc3: The course is specifically designed for introspection and gaining tools that enhance Leadership qualities and soft skills in the participants.

authorAndCurator.author: Priyanka Kumar
authorAndCurator.curator: Art of Livining Faculty

topic.topicTitle: Introspection and gaining tools that enhance Leadership qualities and soft skills in the participants

courseDetail.name: Ethics in Public Service
courseDetail.summary: The objective of the programme is to catalyze and facilitate thinking and action for creative, effective and ethical governance and service.

listDescription.listdesc: Reflect on their original vision, the current reality and the gap
Tap their own and each other’s inner resources for inspiration and learning
Evolve a paradigm of ethical leadership and governance themselves
Discuss issues in governance or in the provision of services and other relationships
Explore the balance of life

topic.topicTitle: Efficient delivery of services
Reduce the dichotomy between the political and administrative wings of the executive
Strengthen existing institutions and Institutional Ethics;
Reduce corruption in the polity and economy
Encourage societal involvement in governance

courseDetail.name: The Theory and Practice of Dispute Resolution
courseDetail.institute: Nani Palkhivala Arbitration Centre, New No 22, Karpagambal Nagar, Mylapore, Chennai
courseDetail.summary: Training program has been tailored specifically to the needs and challenges faced by government officials.

description.desc1: We will incorporate relevant case studies and real-life scenarios to ensure practical applicability.
description.desc2: The course is structured to provide the participants with a strong understanding of the basics and nuances of administrative law, law of contracts, and law of arbitration, which are key to a good foundational understanding of the theory and practice of dispute resolution.
description.desc3: The training will be delivered by seasoned experts in the field of dispute resolution who possess extensive experience in both theory and practice. Participants will benefit from their expertise and gain valuable insights
description.desc4: In addition to the above, keeping in mind the target audience and the purpose of the training, the programme has sessions for analyzing and discussing case studies, field visits to witness arbitration proceedings, and other practical legal matters pertinent to the participants. This provides a unique opportunity for the participants to get a much deeper understanding that combines theoretical knowledge and practical application

authorAndCurator.author: Dr.J.Durgalakshmi
authorAndCurator.curator: Registrar

topic.topicTitle: Administrative law, law of contracts, and law of arbitration

topicDescription.desc1: The course is structured to provide the participants with a strong understanding of the basics and nuances of administrative law, law of contracts, and law of arbitration, which are key to a good foundational understanding of the theory and practice of dispute resolution.

courseDetail.name: Social Policy and Governance
courseDetail.summary: The course is meant to start a dialogue and create a more nuanced understanding of issues in the field of social policy, policy reforms and governance.

description.desc1: The overall objective of the course is to impart a cohesive understanding of issues in policy making and governance. The aim is also to share the experience of academics, researchers, practitioners, experts etc. from diverse fields.
description.desc2: The focus of this training programme will be on best practices related to social policy; the historical evolution, current focus and priorities of social policy, social auditing, data mapping in the social sector and leadership and governance.

authorAndCurator.author: Dr. Bino Paul
authorAndCurator.curator: Deputy Director / Pro-Vice Chancellor, Professor, Centre for Human Resources Management and Labour Relations, School of Management and Labour Studies

authorAndCurator.author: Dr. Mohua Nigudkar
authorAndCurator.curator: she is a faculty member at the Centre for Equity and Justice for Children and Families, School of Social Work, Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Mumbai.

authorAndCurator.curator: is a Professor of Social Work and Dean, Academic Affairs at the Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS), Mumbai.

authorAndCurator.curator: is Professor, Dean, School of Management & Labour Studies, Tata Institute of Social Sciences Mumbai.

authorAndCurator.curator: is Professor, and chairperson - Centre for Livelihoods and Social Innovation, School of Social Work, Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Mumbai Campus.

authorAndCurator.author: Prof. Y S Rajan
authorAndCurator.curator: was Honorary Distinguished Professor ISRO / DOS, with an office at the ISRO Headquarters and also was Chairman, BOG of NIT Manipur. He is a member of Governing Board of Kautilya Entrepreneur and Management Institute (KEMI) of The Jain University Bangalore.

authorAndCurator.author: Dr. Madhushree Sekher
authorAndCurator.curator: Professor at Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS), Mumbai. Currently, she is the Dean of International Relations Office, and Dean, School of Vocational Education, TISS.

authorAndCurator.author: Dr. Soumitra Pathare
authorAndCurator.curator: is a consultant Psychiatrist, and the Director of the Centre for Mental Health Law & Policy, Indian Law Society (ILS) in Pune.

authorAndCurator.author: Dr. Zubin Mulla
authorAndCurator.curator: Professor at the School of Management and Labour Studies at the Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS). He has a degree in Mechanical Engineering from Savitribai Phule Pune University, a Post-Graduate Diploma in Business Management from XLRI Jamshedpur, and a Doctorate in Management from XLRI Jamshedpur.

courseDetail.name: Inner Engineering Leadership Program
courseDetail.summary: Inner Engineering is a technology for wellbeing derived from the ancient science of yoga.

description.desc1: For those seeking professional and personal excellence, this program offers keys for meaningful and fulfilling relationships at work, at home, in the community, and most importantly, within yourself. By fostering an understanding of your interiority, this program empowers you to handle the hectic pace of modern life with ease, experience life to the fullest and fulfill your potential – a potential modern physicists and psychologists say is almost unlimited.

topic.topicTitle: Guided Meditations
Team building exercises
Upa-Yoga Practices
Engaging Discourses
Shambhavi Mahamudra Kriya
Insights on Leadership

courseDetail.name: Infrastructure Finance
courseDetail.institute: Arun Jaitley National Institute of Financial Management
courseDetail.summary: The course has been structured to holistically subserve the knowledge needs and objectives of bureaucrats, officers of All India Service. Officers working under the central staffing scheme, officers of central Secretariat Service (CSS) and Officers of Central Secretariat Stenographer Service (CSSS) (officers of the level of DS/Sr. ppS and above)

description.desc1: Infrastructure financing is essential for promoting and sustaining rapid economic growth. India’s investments in infrastructure have been growing over the years. However, there are several challenges to achieving a successful infrastructure project.

list.listSubject: Thus, an MDP on Infrastructure Finance was designed with the following objectives:

listDescription.listdesc: To lay down a strong conceptual foundation of infrastructure finance among participants
To provide participants with an exposure to the latest developments in the field of infrastructure finance

authorAndCurator.author: Dr. Ashima Arora
authorAndCurator.curator: Assistant Professor, AJNIFM

topic.topicTitle: Understand the scope of infrastructure finance
Appreciate structures such as SPVs, JVs, PPP etc.
Analyze critical aspects that determine the viability of projects using quantitative measures
Understand risk and suggest steps towards mitigation
Conceive and plan projects with improved design and viability

topicDescription.desc1: Infrastructure financing is essential for promoting and sustaining rapid economic growth. India’s investments in infrastructure have been growing over the years. However, there are several challenges to achieving a successful infrastructure project.

courseDetail.name: Digital Governance in Urban Infrastructure Projects Delivery Systems (Evidence based)
courseDetail.summary: To promote innovation and hasten the adoption of digital and smart solutions in urban planning and development, public-private partnerships, investments in research and development, and policy frameworks are being formed. The training course ‘Digital Governance in Urban Infrastructure Project Delivery Systems: Evidence Based’ is highly relevant in this aspect.

description.desc1: Digital and smart urban infrastructure has become a key component of urban development in the context of India. Technology is transforming the way we interact with one another and go about our everyday lives. As a result, everything from business to markets to politics to social contact is changing.
description.desc2: There is a growing emphasis on incorporating technology into urban infrastructure projects as the Indian government stresses the value of digitalization and smart cities. To promote innovation and hasten the adoption of digital and smart solutions in urban planning and development, public-private partnerships, investments in research and development, and policy frameworks are being formed.
description.desc3: The training course ‘Digital Governance in Urban Infrastructure Project Delivery Systems: Evidence Based’ is highly relevant in this aspect. This five-day training course covers a wide variety of subjects, with a particular emphasis on current case studies including digital driven decision-making support systems that have been put into place in cities and towns for infrastructure projects.

procurement – GEM Portal (Policy, standardisation, and Automation)

topicDescription.desc1: The training course ‘Digital Governance in Urban Infrastructure Project Delivery Systems: Evidence Based’ is highly relevant in this aspect. This five-day training course covers a wide variety of subjects, with a particular emphasis on current case studies including digital driven decision-making support systems that have been put into place in cities and towns for infrastructure projects.

courseDetail.name: Training Programme on “Procurement and Allied Laws
courseDetail.institute: National Law School of India University (NLSIU), Bengaluru
courseDetail.summary: The Officers will have a broad understanding of the principles of the law pertaining to contracts, procurement process, administration, cyber law and negotiation and be able to demonstrate their understanding and application of the principles in diverse facts. They will also be able to demonstrate their application to the essentials of formation, performance and discharge of contractual obligations on behalf of the Government.

listDescription.listdesc: To facilitate engagement in identifying, classifying, and evaluating contracts
To engage in discussions on administration practices and Administrative Law
To facilitate understanding of the methods of negotiation and effectively take part in negotiation
To study various modes and types of contract and emerging principles in each of them
To facilitate discussions on principles of cyber law in administration and contracts
To facilitate understanding of the application of general principles of contract in procurement contracts
To study various modes and types of contract and emerging principles in each of them
To familiarise the officers with various legal development in focus area through recent landmark judicial decisions and technological advancements
To familiarise the officers with the mechanism of transactions in contractual law

Arbitration
Negotiation

list.listSubject: Specific skills proposed to be instilled in the participants with regard to governance and administrative/technical skills:

listDescription.listdesc: Understanding of Environmental Laws and their Implementation.
To help policy makers executing integrate environmental concerns into other sectors and address inter-sectoral issues.
To make environmental governance participatory and transparent.
Competency to latest end to end online EIA evaluation process.
To strengthen decision making through impact assessment perspective.

courseDetail.name: Digital Governance and Management
courseDetail.summary: This training program aims to instill necessary inputs about Digital Governance and Management to help the Central and State governments build their capacities to ably support the mission and vision of Digital India

list.listSubject: As identified in the “Guidelines for Capacity Building and Institutional Framework for e-Governance under National e-Governance Plan”, by MeitY-GOI, it is important to build internal capacities in the Government and organizations, so that the functionaries are equipped with the necessary expertise towards:

listDescription.listdesc: Developing the big picture or vision
Steering the program/project
Making strategic decisions
Choosing between competing options
Monitoring
Managing external capacity/agencies for professional handling of tasks and achieving commensurate performance against prescribed goals.

description.desc3: Such capacity-building will lead to realizing the vision of: IT (Indian Talent) + IT (Information Technology) = IT (India Tomorrow).
description.desc4: Digital India initiative is accelerating the progress and development of the country towards a Smart Nation, with people being able to gain access to guaranteed public services and participate more fully in the societal functioning.
description.desc5: To build the capacity of government functionaries, the thematic focus of the proposed course is e-governance, i.e., governance through digital technologies and the course is titled as “Digital Governance & Management”

topic.topicTitle: Digital Transformation, Government as a Platform , Management of Change and Business Process Reengineering ,Design Thinking for Innovation Workshop , Emerging Technologies, Decision Science and Data Science for Policy Design, Digital Product & Service Management , Generative AI and Society, Digital Marketing of Public Services, Information Security , Law & Ethics of digital technologies, Contract Management

topicDescription.desc1: This training program aims to instill necessary inputs about Digital Governance and Management to help the Central and State governments build their capacities to ably support the mission and vision of Digital India.

courseDetail.name: Specialized Course on Law
courseDetail.institute: Jindal Global Law School, Sonipat, Haryana
courseDetail.summary: This course is designed with an objective to train senior government officers in Laws pertaining to good governance.

description.desc1: For any Organization to progress and excel it is imperative to have sound legal knowledge. The leaders of today require that edge to achieve excellence. This course is designed with an objective to train senior government officers in Laws pertaining to good governance. It aims at refreshing the existing knowledge of the leaders with recent inputs and introduction of the latest concepts in legal matters pertaining to Centre and State administration. The module will try and synergize the existing knowledge of the participants so as to rekindle their zeal to bring about a change in their respective organisations.

topic.topicTitle: Writ Jurisdiction of the High Court Public Laws in India: Creating a New Aadhar of Administrative Governance Judicial Review of Administrative Action Environment Litigation & Strategy Departmental Proceedings and Administrative Law Sexual Harassment at workplace

topicDescription.desc1: The module will try and synergize the existing knowledge of the participants so as to rekindle their zeal to bring about a change in their respective organisations.

courseDetail.name: Participatory Management (Community Mobilization)
courseDetail.institute: Institute of Management in Government, Thiruvnanathapuram
courseDetail.summary: The One Week In-Service Training Programme on 'Participatory Management (Community Mobilization)' is a specialized training designed to enhance the officers' skills in effectively engaging with communities and promoting participatory approaches in public administration.

description.desc1: The program aims to equip officers with the tools and techniques needed to facilitate community involvement, collaboration, and decision-making in development projects.
description.desc2: Through interactive sessions, case studies, and practical exercises, participants will learn strategies to foster meaningful partnerships, empower local stakeholders, and implement sustainable solutions that address the needs and aspirations of the communities they serve.

topic.topicTitle: Through interactive sessions, case studies, and practical exercises, participants will learn strategies to foster meaningful partnerships, empower local stakeholders, and implement sustainable solutions that address the needs and aspirations of the communities they serve.
